info.description: The REST API for Roboconf's Administration
info.title: REST API

post.summary: Binds an application for external exports.
post.description: Binds an application for external exports.

parameters.name: bound-app
parameters.description: the name of the application (instance of boundTplName)

parameters.name: bound-tpl
parameters.description: the name of the prefix for external variables

404.description: The application was not found.

403.description: Such a binding is not allowed.

get.summary: Gets the application bindings (as a map).
get.description: Gets the application bindings (as a map).

200.description: Everything went fine (application bindings were returned too).

404.description: The application was not found.

post.description: Replaces application bindings for external exports.

parameters.name: bound-tpl
parameters.description: the name of the prefix for external variables

404.description: The application was not found.

403.description: Such a binding is not allowed.

post.description: Changes the state of an instance for a given application.

404.description: The application or the instance was not found.

403.description: Invalid state or permission issue.

get.description: Lists all the available commands for an application.

404.description: The application was not found.

403.description: The application's description could not be updated.

post.summary: Adds a new instance.
post.description: Adds a new instance.

parameters.name: instance-path
parameters.description: the path of the parent instance (optional, null to consider the application as the root)

404.description: The application or the instance's component was not found.

403.description: The insertion does not comply with the graph definition.

parameters.name: instance-path
parameters.description: the path of the instance to remove

404.description: The application or the instance was not found.

403.description: Invalid instance state.

406.description: The request could not be handled.

get.summary: Lists instances of a given application.
get.description: Lists instances of a given application.

parameters.name: all-children
parameters.description: true to get all the children, false to only get the direct children

parameters.name: instance-path
parameters.description: the instance path (null to consider the whole application)

post.description: Resynchronizes all the instances / agents.

404.description: The application was not found.

404.description: The application or the instance was not found.

get.description: Finds possible components under a given component.

parameters.name: component-name
parameters.description: a component name (if not specified, returns all the root components)

get.summary: Checks the DM can correctly exchange with an agent through the messaging server.
get.description:
Checks the DM can correctly exchange with an agent through the messaging server.

This method acts as followed:

  1. If no message is provided (null), it generates a unique UUID.
  2. It sends the 'PING' message to the specified root-instance-name.
  3. It waits for the agent to respond a 'PONG' to the DM. A wait timeout can be specified by the timeout parameter (default is 1000ms, max DebugResource#MAXIMUM_TIMEOUT ms). Then:
    • If the message is received before the timeout expires, a positive 200 OK response is returned.
    • Otherwise, a negative 408 Request Time-out response is returned.
    • If any unexpected error occurs, a 500 Internal error response is returned.

parameters.name: application-name
parameters.description: the name of the application holding the targeted agent

404.description: The application or the instance was not found.

get.summary: Checks the DM is correctly connected with the messaging server.
get.description:
Checks the DM is correctly connected with the messaging server.

This method acts as followed:

  1. If no message is provided (null), it generates a unique UUID.
  2. It sends the message to the messaging server. The recipient is the DM itself.
  3. It waits for the messaging server to propagate the message to the DM. A wait timeout can be specified by the timeout parameter (default is 1000ms, max DebugResource#MAXIMUM_TIMEOUT ms). Then:
    • If the message is received before the timeout expires, a positive 200 OK response is returned.
    • Otherwise, a negative 408 Request Time-out response is returned.
    • If any unexpected error occurs, a 500 Internal error response is returned.

get.summary: Runs a diagnostic for a given application.
get.description:
Runs a diagnostic for a given application.

The diagnostic is based on the information hold by the DM, and not by the agent.

get.summary: Runs a diagnostic for a given instance.
get.description:
Runs a diagnostic for a given instance.

The diagnostic is based on the information hold by the DM, and not by the agent.

404.description: The application or the instance was not found.

post.summary: Creates a new application.
post.description: Creates a new application.

404.description: The application's template was not found.

403.description: An application with this name already exists.

401.description: The application could not be created (e.g. DM not ready).

get.summary: Lists applications.
get.description: Lists applications.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
if specified, only the application with this name will be returned in the list (null to match all)

We only consider the application name, not the display name. It means that the parameter should not contain special characters.

post.summary: Uploads an image for a template/application.
post.description:
Uploads an image for a template/application.

If an image was already set, it is overridden by the new one.

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: the qualifier of the template, or null for an application.

400.description: The application was not found or the image type or extension is invalid.

post.summary: Loads an application template from a ZIP file.
post.description: Loads an application template from a ZIP file.

406.description: The application could not be created (e.g. invalid).

get.summary: Lists the application templates.
get.description: Lists the application templates.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
if specified, only the templates with this name will be returned (null to match all)

We only consider the application name, not the display name. It means that the parameter should not contain special characters.

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: the exact qualifier to search (null to match all)

404.description: The application was not found.

403.description: The application could not be deleted (e.g. messaging error).

post.summary: Loads an application template from a local ZIP file.
post.description:
Loads an application template from a local ZIP file.

A directory containing a Roboconf application (model + resources) could be fairly heavy (several hundreds of megabytes). We must consider the possibility someone uses a (S)FTP server (or some equivalent solution) to upload a file on the DM's machine.

This operation covers this use case.
It will load an application from a file which was already uploaded on the DM's machine.

parameters.name: local-file-path
parameters.description: the local file path of the application directory

403.description: An application template with this name already exists.

401.description: The application template could not be registered (e.g. DM not ready).

post.summary: Shutdowns an application.
post.description:
Shutdowns an application.

Shutdown means removing everything Roboconf deployed or created. This operation does not delete the application from the model. It only destroys runtime resources.

404.description: The application was not found.

403.description: The application could not be shutdown (e.g. messaging error).

404.description: The application template was not found.

403.description: There are still applications attached to this template.

get.summary: Get a specific or all the preferences.
get.description: Get a specific or all the preferences.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: a specific key, or null to get all the properties

post.summary: Changes a preference value.
post.description:
Changes a preference value.

Notice that preferences cannot be deleted (and created) through the REST API.

post.summary: Saves a job.
post.description: Saves a job.

parameters.name: cmd-name
parameters.description: the name of the commands file to execute

parameters.name: cron
parameters.description: the CRON expression to trigger the job

parameters.name: job-id
parameters.description: the job's ID (null to create a new job)

403.description: If Roboconf's scheduler is not available.

404.description: If the application or the command was not found.

400.description: If a problem arose with the parameters.

get.summary: Lists jobs.
get.description:
Lists jobs.

When no parameter is supplied, all the jobs are returned. When appName is supplied, only the jobs associated with this application are returned. When cmdName is also supplied, only the jobs associated with this application and this command are returned.

When cmdName is supplied but not appName, then no job is returned.

parameters.name: cmd-name
parameters.description: a command name (optional, only makes sense when the application name is given)

403.description: If Roboconf's scheduler is not available.

get.summary: Gets the properties of a given job.
get.description: Gets the properties of a given job.

403.description: If Roboconf's scheduler is not available.

404.description: If the job was not found.

get.summary: Lists targets.
get.description:
Lists targets.

This method can be used to list all the targets, or to filter those associated (as hints) with a given application or application template.

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: an optional qualifier, if we want to list targets for a given application template

post.summary: Creates or updates a target.
post.description: Creates or updates a target.

parameters.name: target-id
parameters.description: an optional target ID (not specified => will be created)

403.description: Invalid target ID or target still in use.

post.summary: Loads target properties from a ZIP file.
post.description: Loads target properties from a ZIP file.

403.description: Invalid target properties.

406.description: The targets could not be registered.

403.description: The target is still in use.

get.summary: Gets the target properties.
get.description: Gets the target properties.

404.description: The target was not found.

post.summary: Associates a target with an instance application.
post.description: Associates a target with an instance application.

parameters.name: target-id
parameters.description: a target ID (useless when bind is false)

parameters.name: bind
parameters.description: true if we should create the association, false to delete it

parameters.name: elt
parameters.description: an instance path or a component name (can be null)

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: a qualifier if the association implies an application template

400.description: No application or application template was found.

403.description: The association could not be created.

get.summary: Gets general information about a target.
get.description: Gets general information about a target.

200.description: Everything went fine (with a description of the target).

404.description: The target was not found.

post.summary: Updates a target's hints.
post.description: Updates a target's hints.

parameters.name: bind
parameters.description: true if we should create the association, false to delete it

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: a qualifier if the hint implies an application template

get.summary: Finds statistics about target usage.
get.description: Finds statistics about target usage.
